DOC.brief_title: Ambient Air Pollution , Preeclampsia , Preterm Delivery
DOC.detailed_description: We design model use local traffic , weather , population characteristic predict monthly ambient concentration fine particulate matter ( PM2.5 ) carbon monoxide ( CO ) . These model use estimate study participant ' PM2.5 CO exposures pregnancy . We test whether air pollutant exposure associate subsequent risk preeclampsia preterm delivery . Additionally , test biological marker maternal lipid peroxidation ( thiobarbituric acid reactive substance ) inflammation ( high sensitivity C-reactive protein ) maternal blood sample draw early pregnancy . We also examine carboxyhemoglobin measure early-pregnancy maternal blood sample marker CO exposure .
DOC.criteria: English speaking enrol parent study pregnant < 20 week gestation attend prenatal care clinic affiliate Swedish Medical Center Tacoma General Hospital
